rest

Class RestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • rest.RestHandler

  • public class RestHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that uses REST to handle all communication between server and client. This class also holds the Canvas objects and their RevisionData. Canvas and RevisionData are mapped to a unique ID. The handler sends String replies formatted according to its ReplyFormat strategy.
    See Also:
    Canvas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RestHandler()
      Constructs a new RestHandler with an empty Canvas list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RestHandler

        public RestHandler()
        Constructs a new RestHandler with an empty Canvas list. Standard ReplyFormat is JsonAndHtmlReply.
        See Also:
        ReplyFormat

    • Method Detail

      • getReplyFormat

        public ReplyFormat getReplyFormat()
        Returns the current ReplyFormat of the RestHandler.
        Returns:
        The current ReplyFormat of the RestHandler.
        See Also:
        ReplyFormat

      • setReplyFormat

        public void setReplyFormat(ReplyFormat replyFormat)
        Sets the ReplyFormat for the RestHandler.
        Parameters:
        replyFormat - The new ReplyFormat for the RestHandler
        See Also:
        ReplyFormat

      • newProject

        public java.lang.String newProject()
        Creates a new project.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.

      • loadProject

        public java.lang.String loadProject(java.lang.String json)
        Loads a project corresponding to the data in the given JSON String.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON String representation of the Canvas to be loaded. Can include a Canvas ID or a full Canvas.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.

      • addLayer

        public java.lang.String addLayer(java.lang.String json)
        Adds a new Layer to the project's Canvas. The JSON parameter needs to specify at least the type of GraphicElement that the Layer should hold.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON String containing parameters for the operation. Needs to specify at least the type of GraphicElement that the Layer should hold.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.

      • deleteLayer

        public java.lang.String deleteLayer(java.lang.String json)
        Deletes a Layer from the project's Canvas. The JSON parameter needs to specify the number of the Layer to be removed.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON String containing parameters for the operation. Needs to specify the number of the Layer to be removed.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.

      • modifyLayer

        public java.lang.String modifyLayer(java.lang.String json)
        Modifies a Layer on the project's Canvas. The JSON parameter needs to specify the number of the Layer to be modified, as well as the attributes of the Layer's GraphicElement that should be modified and their respective new values.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON String containing parameters for the operation. Needs to specify the number of the Layer to be modified, as well as the attributes of the Layer's GraphicElement that should be modified and their respective new values.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.

      • modifyCanvas

        public java.lang.String modifyCanvas(java.lang.String json)
        Modifies the project's Canvas. The JSON parameter needs to specify the attributes of the Canvas to be modified and their respective new values.
        Parameters:
        json - A JSON String containing parameters for the operation. Needs to specify the attributes of the Canvas to be modified and their respective new values.
        Returns:
        The full Canvas of the project, formatted into a String according to the RestHandler's ReplyFormat.
